about_the_game:
Do you like the music of The Cleaning Game but are tired of having to boot up the game and get to a certain part in order to listen to it? Do you get sad when you want the music to be louder, but you have already cranked the music volume slider up to the maximum? Perhaps you even want to listen to the game's music while doing your own real life busywork!

Well, do I have good news for you:

---

The Cleaning Game soundtrack is a double album nearing three hours in length including in-game music and bonus tracks, all tied together with dozens of ambience tracks featuring the game's distinct auditory environment design.

If you liked the in-game sound design, you will love this double album.

---

Soundtrack Exclusive:

14:22 minutes of bonus, unused music as heard in "Gradual Bastardization" and "The Evil in Each of Us"!

Features:

  • Every track blends seamlessly into the next, providing for an uninterrupted listening experience.

  • 3:44 minutes of the ambience within your maintenance closet as heard in "A Closet All of My Own"

  • Excerpts from the surreal afterlife segment as heard in "Sounds from the Land of [REDACTED]"

  • My personal favorite song, "A Simple Celebration of Electronics" which provides a calming and relaxing effect

  • 9:26 minutes of a video game, that may or may not be a dream sequence (it isn't; don't overthink it) as heard in "Warm Dreams of Escapism"

  • 44 other tracks left unmentioned in this description

Well, get listening!

NOTE: It is recommended to turn off the automatic track randomization feature in order to hear the tracks in the order they were designed to be listened.
